medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a healthy 32-year-old man, presented for evaluation of exertional dyspnea and syncope. The symptoms began during exertion, and a murmur was noted. Echocardiography revealed marked septal hypertrophy with a resting left ventricular outflow tract gradient of 68 mm Hg.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) diagnosed, with a pathogenic mutation in MYH7 identified.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father died of a myocardial infarction at 38 years of age, and his paternal uncle died in a single-car accident at 30 years of age. His younger brother is thought to have athleteâ€™s heart.
